title: Album Page, "Four Sketches: Gables, Dormer, and Holy Water Bucket, Gernsbach, Germany", August 10, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top right corner: 4 / (inscribed in circle) 4. Counterclockwise: dormer; Holy water / bucket (copper) / church / (inscribed in circle) A; Gernsbach / Aug 10 1887 / (inscribed in circle) B / gable with water-shed.
description: Vertical sheet with four sketches, clockwise from upper right: dormer; (A) a holy water bucket from a church; a half-timbered façade; (B) a gable with water-shed.  The dormer has a double arched-top window opening and the roof above the dormer is flat.  The holy water bucket is hung by a twisted bale handle on a projecting bracket of copper or wrought iron made of c-scrolls in a Baroque style.  The buliding façade at bottom left is the least refined, and is sketched close to the building as the area under the roof tiles and eaves is visible.  The gable with water-shed is more delicately sketched, showing two bulding rooflines, the one in the background having a projecting eave, visible timber construction, and small window openings punctuating its façades.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Four Sketches: Gables, Dormer, and Holy Water Bucket, Gernsbach, Germany", August 10, 1887.
August 10, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-89.
